API Modules Documentation

This document provides in-depth documentation for the core API modules in the Contact List REST API project.

Main Application Module

async app.main.confirm_email(token, db=Depends(get_db))[source]

Confirms the user’s email using a verification token and changes their status to “active” in the database.

Parameters:

  • token (str) – Email confirmation token.

  • db (AsyncSession) – Database session.

Returns:

Confirmation message on success.

Return type:

dict

async app.main.confirm_password_reset(token, new_password=Form(PydanticUndefined), db=Depends(get_db))[source]

Resets the user’s password using the provided token.

Parameters:

  • token (str) – Password reset token.

  • new_password (str) – New password to set.

  • db (AsyncSession) – Database session.

Returns:

Confirmation message.

Return type:

dict

async app.main.create_contact(contact, db=Depends(get_db), current_user=Depends(get_current_user))[source]

Creates a new contact for the current user.

Parameters:

  • contact (schemas.ContactCreate) – Contact data.

  • db (AsyncSession) – Database session.

  • current_user (models.User) – Currently authenticated user.

Returns:

Newly created contact.

Return type:

schemas.ContactInDB

async app.main.delete_contact(contact_id, db=Depends(get_db), current_user=Depends(get_current_user))[source]

Deletes a specific contact from the database for the current authenticated user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – ID of the contact to delete.

  • db (AsyncSession) – Database session.

  • current_user (models.User) – The currently authenticated user.

Returns:

The deleted contact if successful, otherwise raises HTTP 404.

Return type:

schemas.ContactInDB

async app.main.display_reset_password_form(request, token)[source]

Displays the reset password form.

Parameters:

  • request (Request) – HTTP request.

  • token (str) – Password reset token.

Returns:

HTML template for password reset form.

Return type:

HTMLResponse

async app.main.get_upcoming_birthdays(db=Depends(get_db), current_user=Depends(get_current_user))[source]

Retrieves a list of contacts with birthdays in the next 7 days for the current authenticated user from the database.

Parameters:

  • db (AsyncSession) – Database session.

  • current_user (models.User) – The currently authenticated user.

Returns:

A list of contacts with upcoming birthdays.

Return type:

List[schemas.ContactInDB]

async app.main.login(form_data=Depends(NoneType), db=Depends(get_db))[source]

Authenticates a user and returns access and refresh tokens.

Parameters:

  • form_data (OAuth2PasswordRequestForm) – User login data.

  • db (AsyncSession) – Database session.

Returns:

Access and refresh tokens.

Return type:

schemas.Token

async app.main.read_contact(contact_id, db=Depends(get_db), current_user=Depends(get_current_user))[source]

Retrieves a specific contact from the database by its ID number for the current authenticated user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – ID of the contact.

  • db (AsyncSession) – Database session.

  • current_user (models.User) – The currently authenticated user.

Returns:

The contact details if found, otherwise raises HTTP 404.

Return type:

schemas.ContactInDB

async app.main.read_contacts(db=Depends(get_db), current_user=Depends(get_current_user))[source]

Retrieves all contacts from the database for the current authenticated user.

Parameters:

  • db (AsyncSession) – Database session.

  • current_user (models.User) – The currently authenticated user.

Returns:

A list of contacts.

Return type:

List[schemas.ContactInDB]

async app.main.read_root()[source]

Home page route.

Returns:

Welcome message.

Return type:

dict

async app.main.refresh_token(refresh_token=Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer), db=Depends(get_db))[source]

Refreshes the access token using the provided refresh token.

Parameters:

  • refresh_token (str) – Refresh token for authentication.

  • db (AsyncSession) – Database session.

Returns:

New access token.

Return type:

dict

async app.main.register(user, db=Depends(get_db))[source]

Registers a new user in the database and sends a verification email.

Parameters:

  • user (schemas.UserCreate) – User registration data.

  • db (AsyncSession) – Database session.

Returns:

Registered user details.

Return type:

schemas.UserInDB

async app.main.request_password_reset(email, db=Depends(get_db))[source]

Sends a password reset email to the user.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – User’s email address.

  • db (AsyncSession) – Database session.

Returns:

Message confirming the password reset link was sent.

Return type:

dict

async app.main.search_contacts(query, db=Depends(get_db), current_user=Depends(get_current_user))[source]

Searches contacts in the database based on a query for the current authenticated user.

Parameters:

  • query (str) – Search query for first name, last name, email, or additional info.

  • db (AsyncSession) – Database session.

  • current_user (models.User) – The currently authenticated user.

Returns:

A list of contacts matching the search criteria.

Return type:

List[schemas.ContactInDB]

async app.main.startup()[source]

Initializes connection to Redis and sets up request rate limiting with FastAPI Limiter.

async app.main.update_avatar(file=File(PydanticUndefined), current_user=Depends(get_current_user), db=Depends(get_db))[source]

Uploads and updates the user’s avatar picture using Cloudinary.

Parameters:

  • file (UploadFile) – The uploaded file.

  • current_user (User) – The currently authenticated user.

  • db (AsyncSession) – Database session.

Returns:

The user object with updated avatar URL.

Return type:

UserInDB

async app.main.update_contact(contact_id, contact, db=Depends(get_db), current_user=Depends(get_current_user))[source]

Updates a specific contact in the database for the current authenticated user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – ID of the contact to update.

  • contact (schemas.ContactUpdate) – The updated data for the contact.

  • db (AsyncSession) – Database session.

  • current_user (models.User) – The currently authenticated user.

Returns:

The updated contact if successful, otherwise raises HTTP 404.

Return type:

schemas.ContactInDB

This module (app.main) serves as the main entry point for the application. It contains the FastAPI application instance and key configurations.

Authentication Module

class app.auth.Hash[source]

Bases: object

Utility class for password hashing and verification.

async static get_password_hash(password)[source]

Hash the provided password.

Parameters:

password (str) – The plaintext password to hash.

Returns:

The hashed password.

Return type:

str

async static verify_password(plain_password, hashed_password)[source]

Verify the plain password against the hashed password.

Parameters:

  • plain_password (str) – The plaintext password to verify.

  • hashed_password (str) – The hashed password to verify against.

Returns:

True if the passwords match, otherwise False.

Return type:

bool

async app.auth.authenticate_user(db, email, password)[source]

Authenticate a user by verifying their email and password.

Parameters:

  • db (AsyncSession) – The database session.

  • email (str) – The user’s email address.

  • password (str) – The user’s plaintext password.

Returns:

The authenticated user object if authentication is successful, else None.

Return type:

Optional[User]

async app.auth.create_access_token(data, expires_delta=None)[source]

Create a new access token with an expiration time.

Parameters:

  • data (dict) – The payload data to include in the token.

  • expires_delta (Optional[timedelta]) – Optional expiration delta for the token.

Returns:

The encoded JWT access token.

Return type:

str

async app.auth.create_email_token(data)[source]

Create a short-living email token, typically used for email verification or password reset.

Parameters:

data (dict) – The payload data to include in the token.

Returns:

The encoded JWT email token.

Return type:

str

async app.auth.create_refresh_token(data)[source]

Create a new refresh token with a fixed expiration time.

Parameters:

data (dict) – The payload data to include in the token.

Returns:

The encoded JWT refresh token.

Return type:

str

async app.auth.get_current_user(request, token=Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer), db=Depends(get_db))[source]

Retrieve the current user based on the provided JWT token.

Parameters:

  • request (Request) – The HTTP request object, used for Redis cache access.

  • token (str) – The JWT token extracted from the request.

  • db (AsyncSession) – The database session.

Returns:

The user associated with the token.

Return type:

User

Raises:

HTTPException – If the token is invalid or user cannot be authenticated.

The authentication module (app.auth) provides user authentication logic. It includes functions for JWT token handling, password hashing, and email verification.

CRUD Operations Module

async app.crud.create_contact(db, contact, owner_id)[source]

Creates a new contact for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • db (AsyncSession) – The database session.

  • contact (schemas.ContactCreate) – The data for the new contact.

  • owner_id (int) – The ID of the user who owns the contact.

Returns:

The newly created contact.

Return type:

models.Contact

async app.crud.create_user(db, email, hashed_password)[source]

Creates a new user with the specified email and hashed password.

Parameters:

  • db (AsyncSession) – The database session.

  • email (str) – The user’s email address.

  • hashed_password (str) – The hashed password for the user.

Returns:

The newly created user.

Return type:

models.User

async app.crud.delete_contact(db, contact_id, owner_id)[source]

Deletes a specific contact, ensuring it belongs to the user.

Parameters:

  • db (AsyncSession) – The database session.

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to delete.

  • owner_id (int) – The ID of the user who owns the contact.

Returns:

The deleted contact if found, otherwise None.

Return type:

models.Contact | None

async app.crud.get_contact(db, contact_id, owner_id)[source]

Retrieves a specific contact by its ID, ensuring it belongs to the user.

Parameters:

  • db (AsyncSession) – The database session.

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to retrieve.

  • owner_id (int) – The ID of the user who owns the contact.

Returns:

The contact if found, otherwise None.

Return type:

models.Contact | None

async app.crud.get_contacts(db, owner_id)[source]

Retrieves all contacts of a specific user from database.

Parameters:

  • db (AsyncSession) – The database session.

  • owner_id (int) – The ID of the user who owns the contacts.

Returns:

A list of contacts belonging to the user.

Return type:

list[models.Contact]

async app.crud.get_upcoming_birthdays(db, owner_id)[source]

Retrieves a list of contacts with birthdays in the next 7 days for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • db (AsyncSession) – The database session.

  • owner_id (int) – The ID of the user who owns the contacts.

Returns:

A list of contacts with upcoming birthdays.

Return type:

list[models.Contact]

async app.crud.get_user_by_email(db, email)[source]

Retrieves a user from database by his/her email address.

Parameters:

  • db (AsyncSession) – The database session.

  • email (str) – The user’s email address.

Returns:

The user if found, otherwise None.

Return type:

models.User | None

async app.crud.search_contacts(db, query, owner_id)[source]

Searches database for one or more contacts by first name, last name, email, or additional info.

Parameters:

  • db (AsyncSession) – The database session.

  • query (str) – The search query string.

  • owner_id (int) – The ID of the user who owns the contacts.

Returns:

A list of contacts matching the search criteria.

Return type:

list[models.Contact]

async app.crud.update_avatar(db, email, avatar_url)[source]

Updates the user’s avatar URL.

Parameters:

  • db (AsyncSession) – The database session.

  • email (str) – The user’s email address.

  • avatar_url (str) – The new avatar URL for the user.

Returns:

The updated user with the new avatar URL.

Return type:

models.User

async app.crud.update_contact(db, contact_id, contact, owner_id)[source]

Updates a specific contact’s information, ensuring it belongs to the user.

Parameters:

  • db (AsyncSession) – The database session.

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to update.

  • contact (schemas.ContactUpdate) – The updated data for the contact.

  • owner_id (int) – The ID of the user who owns the contact.

Returns:

The updated contact if found, otherwise None.

Return type:

models.Contact | None

The CRUD module (app.crud) handles database operations for creating, reading, updating, and deleting records in the contact and user tables. It abstracts the database layer, making the logic reusable and clean.

Database Configuration

async app.database.get_db()[source]

Provides a database session for dependency injection in route handlers.

This function is designed to be used as a dependency in FastAPI routes, yielding a database session that can be used within request handlers. The session is automatically closed after the request is processed.

Yield:

A database session.

Return type:

AsyncSession

This module (app.database) includes the database setup and configuration, as well as functions for connecting to the PostgreSQL database. It initializes the database engine and session makers.
